body_html: many functions from torch.nn are useful in a general context too (at least normalize, softmax). in my opinion, the boundaries will become even more flaky, since tensors/variables are merged. some functions in torch.* are also supporting batch-mode like b* functions or matmul. so maybe in the long run, some action will be needed
body_text: many functions from torch.nn are useful in a general context too (at least normalize, softmax). in my opinion, the boundaries will become even more flaky, since tensors/variables are merged. some functions in torch.* are also supporting batch-mode like b* functions or matmul. so maybe in the long run, some action will be needed
body: many functions from `torch.nn` are useful in a general context too (at least normalize, softmax). in my opinion, the boundaries will become even more flaky, since tensors/variables are merged. some functions in `torch.*` are also supporting batch-mode like `b*` functions or matmul. so maybe in the long run, some action will be needed
